docs.snippet: I.B.M.’s SlamTracker software sifts through two decades of data from Grand Slam events to predict and analyze players’ performances and to generate television’s Keys to the Match feature....
docs.lead_paragraph: I.B.M.’s SlamTracker software sifts through two decades of data from Grand Slam events to predict and analyze players’ performances and to generate television’s Keys to the Match feature.
docs.abstract: IBM’s SlamTracker software sifts through two decades of data from Grand Slam tennis events to predict and analyze players’ performances and generate television’s Keys to the Match feature, which broadcasters will use for United States Open analysis.

headline.main: As Tennis Stats Proliferate, Software Tries to Make Sense of It All
headline.print_headline: Software Tries To Make Sense Of the Stats

docs.snippet: Concerned that the presence of homeless people was hurting businesses during an economic revival, leaders in Columbia approved a plan giving the homeless three options: accept help at a shelter, go to jail or leave....
docs.lead_paragraph: Concerned that the presence of homeless people was hurting businesses during an economic revival, leaders in Columbia approved a plan giving the homeless three options: accept help at a shelter, go to jail or leave.
docs.abstract: City Council in Columbia, SC, votes unanimously to pass plan that will essentially evict city's large homeless population; new rules, initiated over concerns that homeless people were hurting city's economic revival, will force homeless to either accept help from shelter, go to jail, or leave city altogether.

headline.main: South Carolina City Takes Steps to Evict Homeless From Downtown
headline.print_headline: Southern Capital Seeks Limits on the Homeless

docs.snippet: Louisville’s willingness to play football games on Tuesday nights, at ESPN’s urging, began a turnaround that led to huge rewards for the university and the network....
docs.lead_paragraph: Louisville’s willingness to play football games on Tuesday nights, at ESPN’s urging, began a turnaround that led to huge rewards for the university and the network.
docs.abstract: Partnership between University of Louisville and ESPN has been boon for school over the past dozen years, fueling its campaign to rise above commuter-school roots to become a powerhouse in college sports; crucial element was Louisville's decision to begin playing football games on Tuesday nights, allowing it to become a mainstay in prime time (Series: Remote Control).

headline.main: At Louisville, Athletic Boom Is Rooted in ESPN Partnership
